Introduction.Description: The Lizardmen, sometimes known as the Cold Ones or the Children of the Gods, are an ancient, savage, intelligent race of cold-blooded, reptilian humanoids that were at one time the first and oldest civilisation of the Warhammer World. Long before the rise of Men, Elf or Dwarf, the empire of the Lizardmen ruled supreme.\n\nAlien, enigmatic, and without mercy, the Lizardmen were there when it all began and will be there when the world draws its last dying breath, never tiring nor relenting until order is finally restored to this uncaring, chaotic world. Such is what they were made to do, for they are the ancient servants of the Old Ones, the one true protectors of this very world

Magic.Name: The Lore of Heaven
Magic.Options: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic
Magic.Enemy: Warriors of Chaos, Lore of Nurgle

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Sotek
Powers.Description: When the unit/character charges, they get +1 Attack for that round of combat

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Tlazcotl
Powers.Description: Immune to Psychology (note that a Carnosaur ridden by a Saurus Oldblood with the Blessed Spawning of Tlazcotl is still subject to Blood-Frenzy, and Cold Ones will still be subject to stupidity)

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Chotec
Powers.Rule: Roll an extra dice when pursuing and choose the highest two (or three if mounted)

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Huanchi
Powers.Rule: May move through jungle, woods and forest as if it were open ground, suffering no penalties for movement
Powers.Description: The unit may move through jungle, woods and forest as if it were open ground, suffering no penalties for movement

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Tepok
Powers.Description: The presence of the unit or character on the battlefield adds one dice to the player's Dispel dice pool

Powers.Name: Blessed Spawning of Itzl
Powers.Description: Characters must take the Blessed Spawning of Itzl if they wish to ride a Cold One or a Carnosaur

Powers.Name: Blessed Mark of the Old Ones
Powers.Rule: May re-roll a total of D3 single D6's per game
Powers.Description: The character may re-roll a total of D3 (roll at the start of the game) single D6's per game. Each re-roll entitles the player to take a single D6 of his own that directly effects the character (including one of the dice rolled as part of a 2D6, 3D6, etc) and roll it again. This can potentially cause Irresistible Force or avoid a Miscast. Remember that you cannot re-roll a dice more than once

Arcane.Name: Cupped Hands of the Old Ones
Arcane.Description: The entire unit that is accompanying the Slann gains a 5+ Ward save. Note, however, that the unit does not get this increase against models that are attacking it in close combat, for they are slightiy inside the mystical shield

Arcane.Name: The Divine Plaque of Protection
Arcane.Rule: Ward save 2+, but not for close combat
Arcane.Description: Increases the Ward save that the Slann gets from 4+ to 2+. Note however, that the Slann does not get this increase against models that are attacking it in close combat, for they are slighdy inside the mystical shield. In close combat, the Slann still only gets a 4+ Ward save

Arcane.Name: Plaque of Dominion
Arcane.Description: Adds an extra +1 dice to the Lizsmdmen player's Power dice and Dispel pools

Arcane.Name: Plaque of Tepok
Arcane.Rule: Knows one more spell than he is normally allowed
Arcane.Description: The Slann knows one more spell than he is normally allowed

Weapon.Name: Blade of Revered Tzanuki
Weapon.Description: +1 Strenght. No armour saves are allowed against attacks made by the Blade of Revered Tzanuki

Weapon.Name: Scimitar of the Sun Resplendent
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this blade has +2 Attacks

Weapon.Name: Staff of the Lost Sun
Weapon.Description: The staff is treated as a short bow that has a Strenght of 5, and 3x Multiple Shots

Weapon.Name: Piranha Blade
Weapon.Description: Any unsaved wound inflicted by the Piranha Blade is multipled into two wounds

Weapon.Name: Blade of Realities
Weapon.Rule: Any wound inflicted on Daemons is multiplied into two wounds
Weapon.Description: No Ward saves are allowed against the Blade of Realities, although Armour saves and Regeneration may be taken as normal. In addition, any wound inflicted on Daemons is multiplied into two wounds (after Armour saves, etc)

Weapon.Name: Dagger of Sotek
Weapon.Description: Confers on the bearer the killing blow ability. In addition, the bearer causes Fear in Skaven

Weapon.Name: Sword of the Hornet
Weapon.Description: The bearer of this sword has the 'Always Strikes First' rule. If an opponent also has the ability to always strike first then resolve their attacks in normal Initiative order

Weapon.Name: Burning Blade of Chotec
Weapon.Description: Targets struck by the Burning Blade of Chotec suffer a -2 penalty to their Armour save in addition to any modifiers from the user's Strength. All attacks made with this weapon count as flaming attacks

Additional.Name: Sacred Stegadon Helm
Additional.Description: Confers +1 to the model's Armour save, which may be combined with other armour as normal. In addition, the helm adds +1 to the model's Leadership

Shield.Name: Shield of the Mirrored Pool
Shield.Description: The shield confers a +1 Armour save like a normal shield. In addition, any magic missile that strikes the bearer or any unit he is with is deflected on the roll of 4+ on a D6. If the spell is deflected, the results of the magic missile is resolved against the caster of the spell or the unit the character is with (following the normal targeting rules). This in turn cannot be dispelled

Shield.Name: The Mainming Shield
Shield.Description: The shield confers a +1 Armour save like a normal shield. In addition, it confers +1 Attack to the model using it. This additional attack is worked out using the base Strength of the wielder, and counts as magical

Additional.Name: Gleaming Pendant of Chotec
Additional.Rule: For one turn, enemy unit that is in contact with the model using the pendant will strike last in combat, one use only
Additional.Description: One use only. The pendant may be used at the start of any Lizardmen player's Close Combat phase. For that turn only, any enemy unit that is in contact with the model using the pendant will strike last in combat - even striking after great weapons and Zombies! If an enemy has the ability to always strike first, then on the roll of a 4+ they get to attack first; if they roll a 1-3, then they too will strike last

Additional.Name: Blood Statuette of Spite
Additional.Description: Bounded Spell. Power Level 5. One use only. Once per game, the user may cast the spell bound within the statuette. The spell may be cast on any enemy character. That character must immediately take Toughness test. If this test is failed, then the model loses a Wound with no armour saves allowed. If the model takes a wound, it must immediately take another Toughness test, losing another wound if it fails again. This continues until either the model passes a Toughness test or is slain

Additional.Name: Cloak of Feathers
Additional.Description: The wearer of the cloack may fly

Additional.Name: Charm of the Jaguar Warrior
Additional.Description: The model's Movement is increased to 9

Arcane.Name: Curse-Charm of Tepok
Arcane.Rule: Enemy mage re-rolls Miscast, one use only
Arcane.Description: After the enemy rolls on the Miscast Table for the first time in the game, the bearer of the Curse-Charm of Tepok may force their opponent to re-roll the result. This second result stands

Weapon.Name: Bane Head
Weapon.Rule: Unsaved wounds doubled for nominated target
Weapon.Description: Nominate an enemy character at the start of the battle. All unsaved wounds caused by the bearer on the nominated target are doubled

Additional.Name: Dragonfly of Quicksilver
Additional.Description: If both players have models with the Scout ability, the Lizardmen player adds 1 to his dice roll when rolling to see eho deploys their Scouts first

Additional.Name: Venom of the Firefly Frog
Additional.Description: All mundane weapons used by the model with the Venom of the Firefly Frog (both close combat weapons and ranged weapons) are coated with this venom. All attacks made with these weapons count as Poisoned Attacks and are magical

Arcane.Name: Rode of the Storm
Arcane.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 5: magic missile that inflicts 2D6 automatic Strength 3 hits (Strength 4 if the target has an Armour save of 4+ or better) on one enemy unit within 18", one use only
Arcane.Description: Bound Spell. Power Level 5. One use only. May be targeted against an enemy unit during the Magic phase. It is a magic missile that inflicts 2D6 automatic Strength 3 hits (Strength 4 if the target has an Armour save of 4+ or better) on one enemy unit within 18". In addition, any unit that suffers wounds from the rod must take an immediate Panic test

Arcane.Name: Cube of Darkness
Arcane.Rule: One spell dispell, all Ramains in Play spells are dispelled, magic phase ends immediately on the roll of a 4+, one use only
Arcane.Description: One use only. This may be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, all Remains in Play spells are automaticaUy removed from play. Finally, roll a D6. The Magic phase ends immediately on the roll of a 4+

Arcane.Name: Diadem of power
Arcane.Rule: Two power dice save for dispel
Arcane.Description: The diadem allows the bearer to save up to two of his own unused Power dice or Dispel dice at the end of any Magic phase and store them, to add to his side's dice pool in the next Magic phase

Additional.Name: Amulet of Itza
Additional.Description: One use only. The character wearing this amulet has a 2+ ward save against the first wound suffered

Additional.Name: Aura of Quetzl
Additional.Rule: 4+ Ward save against attacks with Strength 5 or more
Additional.Description: The bearer of this item has a 4+ Ward save against attacks with Strength 5 or more

Additional.Name: Glyph Necklace
Additional.Description: The character wearing this gains a 5+ ward save

Banner.Name: Sun Standart of Chotec
Banner.Rule: Missles fired at the unit suffer -1 to Hit

Banner.Name: Huanchi's Blessed Totem
Banner.Description: One use only. The unit may use this banner once per game, at the start of any Lizardmen Magic phase. The unit moves direcdy forwards yp to D6". If it runs into an enemy unit, it counts as charging in the next Close Combat phase. The enemy may not make any charge reaction

Banner.Name: Jaguar Standard
Banner.Description: The unit pursues an extra D6"

Original.Rule: The Spirit of venerable Lord Kroak
Ward save 2+, but not in close combat
Extra dice for any spell cast, this dice not come from Power poll and is in affect a 'free' dice
+2 to all attempts to cast and dispell
Strength 5 hit for any wound inflicted

RangeWeapon.Name: Hands of Gods
RangeWeapon.Rule: D6 Strength 4 hits within 8", no Armour saves allowed

Option.Name: Fourth Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table

Option.Name: Third Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table

Option.Name: Second Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table
Extra dice for any spell cast, this dice not come from Power poll and is in affect a 'free' dice
